Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $.193 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $3.714 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

This budget provides funding for modernization of Amphibious Assault Ships.  

Modernization efforts include the procurement and installation of: High Efficiency Small-Capacity (HES-C) Air Conditioning Compressors; Brushless Generators for the PMP; main feed pump replacement; Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communications (SATCC); and Navigation Critical Data System (NCDS/NavCrit).

HES-C provides additional air conditioning capability to support growing electronic cooling requirements. Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators. Main feed pump procurement and install replaces obsolete main feed pumps for the main propulsion boiler.  Additionally, funding supports procurement and installation of SATCC and Navigation Critical Data Distribution (NavCrit) systems in support of capability requirements on Amphibious Assault Ships.

[P40A / Conjunctive HM&E Alterations]: LH002 Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

[P40A / Conjunctive HM&E Alterations]: LH002 Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

[P40A / DC & Ballast Control]: (P40A)

[P40A / LH5IN-LHD MIDLIFE]: LH5IN: Conjunctive HM&E Alteration Installation include the DSA, Planning and Installation costs associated with Conjunctive HM&E Alterations including Degaussing Improvements, HYDRA LHD Upgrades, SCS-Gov LHD Upgrades, IVCN Tech Refresh, Amplified Announcing System Upgrades, Digital DCSS Upgrades, ICT Upgrades, and IVN Upgrades.

Justification.val: Funds provide for modernization of Amphibious Assault Ships.

Name.@footnote: (P40A) LHD 1 Class Hierarchical Yet Dynamically Reprogrammable Architecture (HYDRA) modernization replaces the out of production P7100/MRK fixed and portable radios with XG-75 radios, replaces obsolete AN/SRC-55 (HYDRA) electronic components, adds vital wireless encrypted communications capability in below deck spaces, and incorporates  the industry standard Association of Public Safety Communications Officials (APCO) P-25 signaling protocol. HYDRA Wireless Communication System provides wireless communications capability supporting Flight Deck, Small Boat operations, Damage Control, and Security efforts.  HYDRA modernization will create commonality with equipment installed in the LSD 41/49 class, CG-47 class, and CVN-68 class, as well as new construction including LHA-7, LPD-28, CVN-79 and follow-on hulls.

(P40A) SCS-GOV (LHD7/8, LHA 6/7): The Ship Control System-Government (SCS-GOV) supports the standardization of hardware, software and design of the surface ship Ship Control Systems (SCS) to address hardware and software obsolescence issues. The installation will bring commonality across the LHD 1-8 and LHA-6 hulls.  SCS-GOV replaces the analog Ship Control System (SCS) with a digital SCS. Analog systems are very maintenance intensive constantly requiring alignment of the amplifiers, indicators, and other transmitting devices. The existing system is also largely obsolete requiring cannibalization from decommissioned ships.

(P40A) Integrated Voice Communications Network (IVCN) Tech Refresh: Unifies the obsolete three Integrated Voice Network (IVN) and one J-Dial Private Branch exchange (PBX) switches into a single survivable and redundant distributed IP network.   Replaces obsolete analog and digital telephone terminals. Includes  a Wireless refresh with Digital Enhanced Cordless Telephone (DECT) technology.
Amplified Announcing System Upgrade: Replace the obsolete 1/2/3/5/6/10MC Announcing System with a common survival Digital Integrated Announcing System (DIAS).

(P40A) Digital Defense Communications Subsystem (DCSS) Upgrade: Replaces four full size, 23", obsolete cabinets on LHD 5-7 and two full size, 23", legacy cabinets on LHD 8 and LHA 6 with two 2U ,19" rack mountable IP conference servers. Exterior net terminals and interior non-operational or materially deficient net terminals will be replaced.

(P40A) Integrated Communication Terminals (ICT) modernization replaces the obsolete 7300-Series Programmable Integrated Communications Terminals (PICTs). ICT modernization will align LHD1 - 7 configurations with LHD 8 to meet United States Marine Corp (USMC) requirements.

This solution proposed would implement core cyber resiliency principles, it would implement a Defense-in-Depth Functional Implementation Architecture (DFIA) and meet the requirements of the standards released by the Information Assurance Technical Authority Board (IA TAB) across all the H,M&E systems deploying the ability to protect, detect, react, and restore in a cyber contested environment

Name.val: 2.1) LH5IN LHD Mid-Life  HM&E Alteration Installation

ModificationTitle.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Title.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Name.@footnote: Note (10)  In FY16 one ship-set was procured for install in FY18, but was deferred due to budget marks.  This ship-set will be installed in FY22.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT/Industrial:: Installation Name: Brushless Generator for PMP

Description.val: Brushless Generator Upgrade replaces a LHD's (5) brush-type Ship's Service Turbine Generators that are plagued by severe reliability, maintenance and obsolescence problems.  Brushless Generator Upgrade will reduce both S/F and depot level maintenance requirements, and increase a LHD's electric plant Operational Availability (Ao).

Name.@footnote: FY 2017 funds are required for significant engineering services for Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) improvements, which are required to resolve obsolescence issues in advance of the ship availability start in Q1 FY20.  Funding In FY17 will be used to complete the HES-C Feasibility study, which will include NRE costs for the design of the chiller, production ROM costs, as well as start laying out the interface control document for the chiller that will be required by PY to install.  In FY17 detailed design and production prototype manufacture will begin and anticipates put that unit through full first article testing to support FY 19 procurement.

Description.val: The High Efficiency Super Capacity (HES-C) replaces the ship's existing 300-ton Air Conditioners (A/C) with a 450-ton capable A/C plant that meet the demand of new electronic warfare systems and will improve operational availability of the A/C plant.

Name.@footnote: Non-reoccurring engineering in FY17 required for Main Feed Pump to procure test article and set up environmental quality testing for test article to ensure design is technically mature prior to procurement of first Ship-set. First procurement deferred from FY20 to FY23 due to budget cuts.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Main Feed Pump

Description.val: [Main Feed Pump] Replacement of obsolete main feed pump with new shock qualified unit to meet service life.

Name.val: 1.1.1) Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communication (SATCC) - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communication (SATCC)

Description.val: Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communication (SATCC) provides highly reliable Air Traffic Control (ATC) voice communications between pilots and ATC team, command and control, and connection to administrative jdial services throughout the ship.  This installs a ruggedized, Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) system that addresses Safety of Flight concerns due to cumbersome communication controls that degrades ATC's situational awareness during flight operations.  This install will establish commonality across CVN, LHD and LHA classes.

Name.@footnote: NAVCRIT must be installed conjunctive with both SSDS MK II and CIC Room Rearrangement SCDs.  Budget/funding must remain aligned across the FYDP.  Increased install cost from FY 21 to FY 22 is greater than the inflation rate due to the difference in port man-day rate.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Industrial:: Installation Name: Navigation Critical Data Distribution (NavCrit)

Description.val: The Navigation Critical Distribution System (NCDS) procurements will be installed on LHD Class ships to replace and consolidate current analog Interior Communications (IC) data signals on the MK 70 and IC Switchboards, as well as analog indicators throughout the ships. The removal of the AN/USQ-82(V) Shipboard Data Multiplexer System (SDMS) will also be included. Network switches will be installed to provide data transmission from the NAVSSI Real Time Subsystem (RTS) to all clients and devices that require navigation data. Input Output Controllers (IOC) will be installed to convert the Navigation Sensor System Interface (NAVSSI) Standard Navigation Message from Ethernet to the required analog signal.  Programmable Logic Controllers will be installed to handle all Navigation related alarms. Navigation Displays and Navigation Management Data Terminals (Alarm Panels) will be installed in various locations to provide the NAVCERT required data and alarms in the appropriate locations. A distributed IRIG-B timing architecture is also included, which includes IRIG-B clocks.

ModificationTitle.val: LH001 Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS)

Name.val: 2.1) Propulsion and Auxilary Control System (PACS)  Eng Services

Title.val: LH001 Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS)

Name.@footnote: Increase in Engineering Services from FY 20 to FY 21 and follows, is due to Engineering Services requirements for FY 22 and FY 23 install.    Increased install cost from FY 22 to FY 23 is greater than the inflation rate due to the difference in port man-day rate.
Name.val: 1.1.1) Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement

Description.val: [Propulsion and Auxiliary Control System (PACS) procurement] Damage Control (DC) & Ballast Control: Includes the installation of the DC & Ballast Control Systems as well as the Propulsion and Auxiliary Control Systems (PACS). The Damage Control System (DCS) and Ballast Control System (BCS) replace the existing consoles for the Ballast/DeBallast, Fireman, Fire Fighting, AFFF, and Tank Level Indication systems. This new system will provide greater situational awareness to watch standers as well as address critical obsolescence issue with the existing consoles. The PACS installation includes HM&E Network and Zonal Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) infrastructure necessary for the safety critical Ballast Control Console and Damage Control Console Replacement and also upgrades the Interior Communication System Monitoring (IC/SM) alarm switchboards.

ModificationTitle.val: LH001 - Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Control)

Title.val: LH001 - Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Control)

Name.@footnote: Recommend Power Management Platform (PMP) be installed concurrently with Brushless Generator to leverage access cuts and interference removal, reducing total install cost.

Description.val:
[PMP  (Set 19) Procurement] Power Management Platform (PMP) modernization converts legacy controls to a digital automated control system.  This system gathers and combines all Electric plant data so that it is available at any electric plant control station.  PMP simplifies multiple step control sequences into single step operations and makes possible control capabilities that were previously too cumbersome for operators to perform. i.e. Baseload, and Real / Reactive power balancing. PMP implements a gradual Ship Service Turbine Generator (SSTG) turbine startup/shutdown sequence which allows the turbine to achieve stabilized temperatures more consistently, reducing stress on components and contributing to prolonged service life.  System automation reduces electrical system transients and stress on breaker components by employing a Zero Power Transfer (ZPT) strategy, which limits the current flow through an individual breaker to zero during open/close evolutions.  
Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls) must be installed concurrently.  Collectively, these two non-severable modernization efforts provide enhanced electric plant (EP) situational awareness, reliability flexibility, and survivability through replacement of obsolete breakers with breakers currently used in other ship classes and through installation of modern electric plant controls and alarms.  Brushless Generator Install must be accomplished prior to or concurrent with Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls).
